org.svvrl.goal.gui.editor
Class PropertyEditor

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.svvrl.goal.gui.editor.PropertyEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
EditablePropertyEditor
public abstract class PropertyEditor
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A PropertyEditor is a panel used to edit properties of some object. A property essentially has a name and a value. The properties of the object can be separated into groups.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

width

protected int width
The width of a text field.

Constructor Detail

PropertyEditor

public PropertyEditor(Editor<?> editor,
                      java.lang.Object obj)
Constructs this property editor with an object with properties in one group to be edited in this editor and the owner editor of the object. The editor containing the object is needed because when some property of the object is changed, the corresponding undoable edit should be posted to the owner editor.

Parameters:
editor - the editor containing the object obj
obj - the object to be edited in this property editor

PropertyEditor

public PropertyEditor(Editor<?> editor,
                      java.lang.Object obj,
                      int groups)
Constructs this property editor with an object with properties in groups to be edited in this editor and the owner editor of the object. The editor containing the object is needed because when some property of the object is changed, the corresponding undoable edit should be posted to the owner editor.

Parameters:
editor - the editor containing the object obj
obj - the object to be edited in this property editor
groups - the number of property groups, which should be greater than 0
Method Detail

addProperty

protected void addProperty(java.awt.Component label,
                           java.awt.Component input)
Inserts a row containing a property to the first group in this editor. A row is supposed to have two columns. The first column is the name of the property. The second column is a component used to display and change the value of the property.

Parameters:
label - the label of the property at this row
input - the component for displaying and changing the value of the property at this row

addProperty

protected void addProperty(int group,
                           java.awt.Component label,
                           java.awt.Component input)
Inserts a row containing a property to a specified group in this editor. A row is supposed to have two columns. The first column is the name of the property. The second column is a component used to display and change the value of the property.

Parameters:
group - the index of the destination group
label - the label of the property at this row
input - the component for displaying and changing the value of the property at this row

getEditor

public Editor<?> getEditor()
Returns the editor containing the object with properties being edited in this property editor.

Returns:
the editor containing the object with properties being edited in this property editor

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject()
Returns the object with properties being edited in this property editor.

Returns:
the object with properties being edited in this property editor

reload

public abstract void reload()
Reloads the properties.

apply

public abstract void apply()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Applies the effect of edits done in this property editor to the object.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some of the edit is invalid

editorActivated

public abstract void editorActivated()
Invoked when this editor is activated in the property dialog.

editorInactivated

public abstract void editorInactivated()
Invoked when this editor is inactivated in the property dialog.

setReadOnly

public abstract void setReadOnly(boolean b)
Sets true if the owner editor of the object with properties to be edited in this property editor becomes read-only.

Parameters:
b - true if the owner editor of the object with properties to be edited in this property editor becomes read-only

setAutoRefresh

public void setAutoRefresh(boolean b)
Sets the automatic refresh of properties.

Parameters:
b - true if the properties should be refreshed (reloaded) automatically when they are changed

isAutoRefresh

public boolean isAutoRefresh()
Returns true if the properties should be refreshed (reloaded) automatically when they are changed.

Returns:
true if the properties should be refreshed (reloaded) automatically when they are changed
